document_data.mainbody:
alil Entwine was a business owner and a mayor of a Chondathan fishing town of Samra circa 1370 DR.
The mayor was a quiet and timid man whose bark was worse than his bite. Malils biting words were rarely backed up by actions. Mayor Entwin made sure Samras taxes made their way to Arrabar in a timely and secure manner according to schedule.
Malil Entwine was an elected official in Samra, who joined the citys ruling council of elders sometimes in or before the . Malils political career sprouted from owning a local fishery.
